Hilles (Frederick W.) Manuscript Collection and Papers
titlestmt.author: by Alison Clemens

did.unittitle: Frederick W. Hilles Manuscript Collection and Papers

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Manuscript collection and papers of Frederick W. Hilles. The manuscript collection includes correspondence and writings by James Boswell, Thomas and Jane Carlyle, Samuel Johnson, Joshua Reynolds, and members of their families. The papers include personal and professional correspondence; research files and writings; personal and family papers, including material related to Susan Morse Hilles and Charles Dewey Hilles; teaching materials from Hilles' tenure at Yale University and Temple University; and material documenting Hilles' service on the boards of the Yale Library Associates and the Yale University Press.

langmaterial.language: Chiefly in English; some manuscripts in French, Italian, Spanish, and Latin.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Frederick W. Hilles Manuscript Collection and Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Frederick W. Hilles Manuscript Collection. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

The Frederick W. Hilles Manuscript Collection and Papers was comprehensively reprocessed in 2016 to encompass the manuscript collection and personal papers of Frederick W. Hilles. The manuscript collection retained its previously existing description and arrangement, and the papers received folder level description and arrangement.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards. For more information, please refer to the Beinecke Manuscript Unit Processing Manual.
Former call number: MS Vault Hilles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of correspondence and other manuscript writings by James Boswell, Thomas Carlyle, Samuel Johnson, Joshua Reynolds, and members of their families, collected by Frederick W. Hilles. Also includes manuscripts, correspondence, personal papers and classroom materials from Frederick W. Hilles.

Manuscript collection and papers of Frederick W. Hilles. The manuscript collection includes correspondence and writings by James Boswell, Thomas and Jane Carlyle, Samuel Johnson, Joshua Reynolds, and members of their families. The papers include personal and professional correspondence; research files and writings; personal and family papers, including material related to Susan Morse Hilles and Charles Dewey Hilles; teaching materials from Hilles' tenure at Yale University and Temple University; and material documenting Hilles' service on the boards of the Yale Library Associates and the Yale University Press.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Frederick W. Hilles Manuscript Collection, 1645-1969. II. Frederick W. Hilles Papers, 1775-1979.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript collection of Frederick W. Hilles, including correspondence and writings by James Boswell, Thomas and Jane Carlyle, Samuel Johnson, Joshua Reynolds, and members of their families.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I is organized into four subseries: Literary and Historical Manuscripts, Carlyle Manuscripts, Johnson Manuscripts, and Miscellaneous Prints and Art.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A collection of manuscripts and letters by or relating to Sir Walter, including:
1. Scott, Sir Walter. "Upon the Ancient History of Scotland": autograph manuscript draft of a portion of the history, circa 1825-1830.
2. Unidentified. "Universal History": autograph manuscript draft of chapters I-VII. 1804 April 29.
3. Scott, Sir Walter. Unidentified autograph manuscript, circa 1816.
4. Scott, Sir Walter. "Singular adventure of an odd arm case...": autograph manuscript, circa 1829.

5. Scott, Sir Walter. 5 letters (copies in an unidentified hand) to Capt. Basil Hall: 1825 June 15, Edinburgh; 1825 October 13, Abbotsford; 1827 February 26; 1827 April 1?; 1829 September 23, Abbotsford. With notes by Basil Hall. In brown paper covers with signature of J. G. Lockhart on the front cover.

6. Scott, Sir Walter. "Trials and other proceedings in matters criminal before the High Court of Justiciary in Scotland...": manuscript review of Pitcairn's work, with autograph corrections and additions by Scott, circa 1829.
7. Unidentified. The illness of King George III: manuscript copy of notes, circa 1835.
8. Unidentified. Manuscript notes on Ireland, circa 1824.
9. Cockburn, Sir George. "Extract from the diary of Rear Admiral Sir George Cockburn with particular reference to General Napoleon Buonaparte...": manuscript copy in an unidentified hand, circa 1815.
10. Cockburn, Sir George? Memoirs of Napoleon Buonaparte: manuscript notes in an unidentified hand, circa 1815 July 31.
11. Cockburn, Sir George? Description of Napoleon Buonaparte: manuscript notes in an unidentified hand, circa 1815 July 31.
12. Scott, Sir Walter. "Tales of My Landlord": proofs of the Introduction with autograph corrections by Scott, circa 1830.
13. Unidentified. "Quentin Durwood": manuscript notes on Quentin Durward, circa 1835.
14. "List of Sir Walter Scott's Writings": manuscript in an unidentified hand, undated. With autograph manuscript note by Sir Walter Scott listing six of his writings.
Bound together in quarter brown leather and paper boards, labelled on front cover "Scott Papers Reviews etc."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Diary covering events of the Johnson family, primarily the period from 1780 to 1874, taken from the letters and journals of various family members. Includes a list of photographs, drawings, etc. on the first two pages and a list of clerical descendants and inter-marriages with Reynolds on page 48. Written in ink, pencil, and blue pencil in several hands. 51 pages. Includes the following laid in:
1. Martin, J. Portion of a letter to Miss Johnson, 1824 July 19.
2. Notes, 2 leaves.
3. Clipping on aurora borealis, 1831 January 7, with a manuscript note on the verso.
4. Peurore, John. Letter to Miss Johnson.
5. Diary, covering 1768-1800, 12 pages.

6. Letter dated 1818 September 5, 3 pages.
7. Clipping, "Coaching Extraordinary...", January 1873.
8. J., E. M. Letter to Mr. Sutton, 2 pages.
9. Obituary clipping about Lord Harris.
10. Obituary clipping about Lord Rolly.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Professional and personal papers of Frederick W. Hilles and his family, including personal and professional correspondence; research files; writings; personal and family papers, including material related to Susan Morse Hilles and Charles Dewey Hilles; teaching materials from Hilles' tenure at Yale University and Temple University; and material documenting Hilles' service on the boards of the Yale Library Associates and the Yale University Press.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
